results.title: Metformin in Combination with Progesterone Improves the Pregnancy Rate for Patients with Early Endometrial Cancer
results.text_hl: There were 8 (13.3%) and 5 (8.3%) cases of @DISEASE_Gastrointestinal_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D005767 @@@gastrointestinal reactions@@@, 6 (10.0%) and 6 (10.0%) cases of @<m>DISEASE_Headache</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006261 @@@headache@@@, 5 (8.3%) and 5 (8.3%) cases of @DISEASE_Sleep_Initiation_and_Maintenance_Disorders @DISEASE_MESH:D007319 @@@insomnia@@@ in the @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ group and control group, respectively.

citations.NLM: Yuan F, Hu Y, Han X, Li Q. Metformin in Combination with Progesterone Improves the Pregnancy Rate for Patients with Early Endometrial Cancer Contrast Media Mol Imaging. 2022;2022():1961016. PMID: 35854762

results.title: Bioequivalence and pharmacokinetic comparison of two fixed dose combination of Metformin/ Glibenclamide formulations in healthy subjects under fed condition.
results.text_hl: Bioequivalence and pharmacokinetic comparison of two fixed dose combination of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@/ @CHEMICAL_Glyburide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005905 @@@Glibenclamide@@@ formulations in healthy subjects under fed condition.

citations.NLM: Chang CT, Ang JY, Wong JM, Tan SS, Chin SK, Lim AB, Tan WH, Yuen KH. Bioequivalence and pharmacokinetic comparison of two fixed dose combination of Metformin/ Glibenclamide formulations in healthy subjects under fed condition. Med J Malaysia. 2020 May;75(3):286-291. PMID: 32467546

results.title: Demographic, diagnostic and therapeutic characteristics of autosomal dominant polycystic kidney disease in Ghana
results.text_hl: Clinical features include @DISEASE_Abdominal_Pain @DISEASE_MESH:D015746 @@@flank and abdominal pain@@@, bipedal @DISEASE_Edema @DISEASE_MESH:D004487 @@@swelling@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Headache</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006261 @@@headache@@@, amongst others.

citations.NLM: Okyere P, Ephraim RKD, Okyere I, Attakorah J, Serwaa D, Essuman G, Abaka-Yawson A, Adoba P. Demographic, diagnostic and therapeutic characteristics of autosomal dominant polycystic kidney disease in Ghana BMC Nephrol. 2021 Apr 28;22(1):156. PMID: 33910506

results.title: [Cross-Sectional Study on Adverse Effects of Metformin Hydrochloride on 130 Patients Type 2 Diabetic Admitted to Medical Center and Diabetes Home of Sidi Bel-Abbes].
results.text_hl: Five (3.85%) @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ had a total and lasting intolerance to @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@MetforminHydrochloride@@@ leading to its discontinuation following persistent @DISEASE_Diarrhea @DISEASE_MESH:D003967 @@@diarrhoea@@@.

citations.NLM: Sakouhi M, Matmour D, Belakhdar K, Kraroubi A. [Cross-Sectional Study on Adverse Effects of Metformin Hydrochloride on 130 Patients Type 2 Diabetic Admitted to Medical Center and Diabetes Home of Sidi Bel-Abbes]. Ann Pharm Fr. 2022 Dec 2;():. PMID: 36464072

results.title: Pharmacological and non-pharmacological strategies for obese women with subfertility.
results.text_hl: Pharmacological versus pharmacological intervention For @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ plus liraglutide compared to @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ we are uncertain of an effect on the adverse events @DISEASE_Nausea @DISEASE_MESH:D009325 @@@nausea@@@ (OR 7.22, 95% CI 0.72 to 72.7; 28 @SPECIES_9606 @@@women@@@, 1 study; very low-quality evidence), @DISEASE_Diarrhea @DISEASE_MESH:D003967 @@@diarrhoea@@@ (OR 0.31, 95% CI 0.01 to 8.3; 28 @SPECIES_9606 @@@women@@@, 1 study; very low-quality evidence), and @<m>DISEASE_Headache</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006261 @@@headache@@@ (OR 5.80, 95% CI 0.25 to 133; 28 @SPECIES_9606 @@@women@@@, 1 study; very low-quality evidence).

citations.NLM: Taghavi SA, van Wely M, Jahanfar S, Bazarganipour F. Pharmacological and non-pharmacological strategies for obese women with subfertility. Cochrane Database Syst Rev. 2021 Mar 25;3(3):CD012650. PMID: 33765343
citations.BibTeX: @article{33765343, title={Pharmacological and non-pharmacological strategies for obese women with subfertility.}, author={Taghavi SA and van Wely M and Jahanfar S and Bazarganipour F}, journal={Cochrane Database Syst Rev}, volume={3}, number={3}, pages={CD012650}}

results.title: COVID-19 is associated with high blood glucose levels: diabetic neuropathy during the SARS-CoV-2 pandemic: a case report.
results.text_hl: Seventeen years prior, she was diagnosed with @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2 @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@type 2 diabetes mellitus@@@. @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ 1.5 g twice a day and @CHEMICAL_Glyburide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005905 @@@glibenclamide@@@ 10 mg twice a day were part of her therapy regimen.

citations.NLM: Bereda G. COVID-19 is associated with high blood glucose levels: diabetic neuropathy during the SARS-CoV-2 pandemic: a case report. Ann Med Surg (Lond). 2024 Dec;86(12):7318-7321. PMID: 39649935
citations.BibTeX: @article{39649935, title={COVID-19 is associated with high blood glucose levels: diabetic neuropathy during the SARS-CoV-2 pandemic: a case report.}, author={Bereda G}, journal={Ann Med Surg (Lond)}, volume={86}, number={12}, pages={7318-7321}}

results.title: NITROSOGENESIS OF SKIN (HUMAN) CANCER- THE HIDDEN TRUTH OF A NEVERENDING STORY: NITROSAMINE CONTAMINATION IN OLMESARTAN, VALSARTAN AND HCT AS MAIN RISK FACTOR FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF KERATINOCYTE CANCER.
results.text_hl: The newly introduced regulatory norms in practice concern the potential/permissive availability of @CHEMICAL_Nitrosamines @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009602 @@@nitrosamines@@@ in a serious number of drugs: drugs with radically different mechanisms of action such as: @CHEMICAL_Ranitidine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011899 @@@ranitidine@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, ACE inhibitors, beta blockers, thiazide diuretics, sartans, @CHEMICAL_Rifampin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D012293 @@@rifampicin@@@, but also probably a number of others.

citations.NLM: Tchernev G, Kordeva S. NITROSOGENESIS OF SKIN (HUMAN) CANCER- THE HIDDEN TRUTH OF A NEVERENDING STORY: NITROSAMINE CONTAMINATION IN OLMESARTAN, VALSARTAN AND HCT AS MAIN RISK FACTOR FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF KERATINOCYTE CANCER. Georgian Med News. 2023 Apr;(337):63-67. PMID: 37354675
citations.BibTeX: @article{37354675, title={NITROSOGENESIS OF SKIN (HUMAN) CANCER- THE HIDDEN TRUTH OF A NEVERENDING STORY: NITROSAMINE CONTAMINATION IN OLMESARTAN, VALSARTAN AND HCT AS MAIN RISK FACTOR FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF KERATINOCYTE CANCER.}, author={Tchernev G and Kordeva S}, journal={Georgian Med News}, number={337}, pages={63-67}}

results.title: Changes in weight, papilledema, headache, visual field, and life status in response to diet and metformin in women with idiopathic intracranial hypertension with and without concurrent polycystic ovary syndrome or hyperinsulinemia.
results.text_hl: If @<m>DISEASE_Headache</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006261 @@@headache@@@ persisted on therapy, it was less intense-less frequent (P = 0.03) in the diet-only group and in the @DISEASE_Polycystic_Ovary_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D011085 @@@PCOS@@@-@<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@MET@@@ group (P = 0.04).

citations.NLM: Glueck CJ, Golnik KC, Aregawi D, Goldenberg N, Sieve L, Wang P. Changes in weight, papilledema, headache, visual field, and life status in response to diet and metformin in women with idiopathic intracranial hypertension with and without concurrent polycystic ovary syndrome or hyperinsulinemia. Transl Res. 2006 Nov;148(5):215-22. PMID: 17145568

results.title: GLP-1 receptor agonists versus metformin in PCOS: a systematic review and meta-analysis.
results.text_hl: GLP-1 receptor agonists were associated with a higher incidence of @DISEASE_Nausea @DISEASE_MESH:D009325 @@@nausea@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Headache</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006261 @@@headache@@@ than @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, but there were no significant differences in other data.

citations.NLM: Han Y, Li Y, He B. GLP-1 receptor agonists versus metformin in PCOS: a systematic review and meta-analysis. Reprod Biomed Online. 2019 Aug;39(2):332-342. PMID: 31229399
citations.BibTeX: @article{31229399, title={GLP-1 receptor agonists versus metformin in PCOS: a systematic review and meta-analysis.}, author={Han Y and Li Y and He B}, journal={Reprod Biomed Online}, volume={39}, number={2}, pages={332-342}}

results.title: The effects of metformin with lifestyle therapy in polycystic ovary syndrome: a randomized double-blind study.
results.text_hl: The @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@MET@@@ group had increased @DISEASE_Diarrhea @DISEASE_MESH:D003967 @@@diarrhea@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Headache</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006261 @@@headache@@@, but fewer @DISEASE_Urinary_Bladder_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D001745 @@@bladder infections@@@ and @DISEASE_Musculoskeletal_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D009140 @@@musculoskeletal complaints@@@.

citations.NLM: Ladson G, Dodson WC, Sweet SD, Archibong AE, Kunselman AR, Demers LM, Williams NI, Coney P, Legro RS. The effects of metformin with lifestyle therapy in polycystic ovary syndrome: a randomized double-blind study. Fertil Steril. 2011 Mar 1;95(3):1059-66.e1-7. PMID: 21193187
citations.BibTeX: @article{21193187, title={The effects of metformin with lifestyle therapy in polycystic ovary syndrome: a randomized double-blind study.}, author={Ladson G and Dodson WC and Sweet SD and Archibong AE and Kunselman AR and Demers LM and Williams NI and Coney P and Legro RS}, journal={Fertil Steril}, volume={95}, number={3}, pages={1059-66.e1-7}}
